frameDefinitions: A Cognizer decides upon the Chosen (either an item or a course of action) out of a set of  Possibilities .
A particular piece of Information is evaluated for its accuracy.
This frame has to do with the bias or lack of bias of a Judge making an assessment concerning two or more Sides.
An individual or group, the Rebel, rejects the authority of the Current_leadership, and attempts to bring them out of power.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Responsible_party is required to perform some Duty.
frameExamples: The council <t>picked</t> you out of all the pilots available to head this mission.
Is your reputation at risk due to <t>incorrect</t> information?
In 1641 there was a Catholic <t>rebellion</t> against the Protestants of Ulster, and English authority over the island was shaken.
It is my <t>duty</t> to fight any attack on the Brotherhood .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> chooses the <fen>Chosen</fen> out of the <fen>Possibilities</fen>.
<fen>Chosen</fen> identifies the entity or course of action which is selected from among the <fen>Possibilities</fen>.

A <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes a choice from among a set of <fen>Possibilities</fen>. <fen>Possibilities</fen> are commonly expressed via an oblique phrase which indicates the alternative or alternatives, or by a subordinate clause (choosing to do it or choosing not to do it), typically headed by 'whether or 'if'.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> chooses the <fen>Chosen</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the choosing occurs.
The <fen>Information</fen> matches or does not match the facts of the world.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the agent who holds the correct/incorrect information.
The event which communicates the <fen>Information</fen>.
The Topic about which the Source has accurate information.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Information</fen> or the <fen>Source</fen> is correct.
This Frame Element marks the person whose objectivity in making assesment is being evaluated.
This Frame Element marks one of the <fen>Sides</fen> in a dispute or one of the alternatives in a situation of choice.
This Frame Element marks phrases jointly expressing both <fen>Sides</fen> in a dispute or all of the alternatives in a situation of choice.
The second-mentioned of the <fen>Sides</fen> to a dispute or alternatives in a situation of choice.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate how the bias of the <fen>Judge</fen> expresses itself in their behavior or actions.
The <fen>Dispute</fen> is the situation in which there is some conflict between two sides.
The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the judgment denoted by the target.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Decision_maker</fen>.
This role denotes the time when the partiality occurs.
The individual or group within a society that attempts to overturn the <fen>Current_leadership</fen>, and possibly also the <fen>Current_order</fen> of governance.
The people currently in power, whom the <fen>Rebel</fen>s attempt to overthrow.
The currently-existing system of authority or government.
The time when the rebellion takes place.
The location of the rebellion.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The time interval during which the Responsibly_party is obligated to fulfill the Duty.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
listRoleExamples: <fex>We</fex>have to pick a colour for the living room.
I decided <fex>to give it another try</fex>.
They chose their new guitarist <fex>out of more than 300 auditioners</fex>.
I was n't chosen <fex>in the last round</fex>.
The winner was selected <fex>in the secret meeting room</fex>.
<fex>That statement</fex> is totally incorrect.
<fex>He</fex> is correct
<fex>The referee</fex> was totally biased against our team.
The umpire was partial <fex>to the home team</fex>.
The judge was neutral <fex>between the parties</fex>.
The judge favored the defendant <fex>over the plaintiff</fex>.
The judge made a biased <fex>decision</fex>.
My sister remained neutral <fex>in our disputes</fex>.
He had a neutral <fex>smile</fex> on his face.
In 1641 there was a <fex>Catholic</fex> rebellion against the Protestants of Ulster, and English authority over the island was shaken.
It was the first time that a man of such high rank had been put to death for rebellion <fex>against the king</fex>.
At the time they were in rebellion <fex>against the Catholic government</fex>.
Did you support the insurrection <fex>of 1854</fex>?
It seems probably that rebellion <fex>in East Anglia</fex> was as rigorously suppressed as in Kent.
<fex>Everyone</fex> has the obligation to vote.
My job is <fex>to get to the other side of the bridge</fex>.
<fex>At that time</fex> men were obligated to marry women from their own community.
I almost forgot to tell you that <fex>in Sweden</fex> we are obligated to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: During Develop, Operation Flashpoint: Red River
the People's Liberation Army of China
